metadata.title: CVE-2016-8640 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A SQL injection vulnerability in pycsw all versions before 2.0.2, 1.10.5and 1.8.6 that leads to read and extract of any data from any table in thepycsw database that the database user has access to. Also on PostgreSQL (atleast) it is possible to perform updates/inserts/deletes and databasemodifications to any table the database user has access to.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8640` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pycsw - 2.0.2+dfsg-1
pycsw-wsgi - 2.0.2+dfsg-1
python-pycsw - 2.0.2+dfsg-1
python-pycsw-wsgi - 2.0.2+dfsg-1
python3-pycsw - 2.0.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pycsw package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.2+dfsg-1').
